meanings.definition: The act or process of simulating something.
meanings.sent1: The virtual simulation of a roller coaster ride was so realistic!
meanings.sent2: The flight simulation helped the pilot practice landing in different weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: During the simulation of a space mission, the astronaut accidentally pressed the wrong button and launched a toy rocket.
meanings.sent4: Her dream felt like a simulation of flying through the clouds, weightless and free.
meanings.sent5: The simulation of a bustling city street was complete with honking cars and chattering pedestrians.

meanings.sent1: The simulation of a thunderstorm in the play was very convincing.
meanings.sent2: The computer program created a simulation of a famous painting.
meanings.sent3: The children's simulation of a tea party was adorable with their plastic cups and saucers.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a simulation of happiness, masking his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The simulation of a roaring lion made the audience jump in their seats.

meanings.definition: A model or replica of something.
meanings.sent1: The architect presented a simulation of the new building design to the committee.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a simulation of an ancient Greek temple.
meanings.sent3: The toy car was a simulation of a real race car, just smaller.
meanings.sent4: The garden gnome was a simulation of a tiny, bearded man guarding the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The simulation of a dinosaur skeleton was so detailed, it looked like the real thing.
